description: Conversion of ballroom into 7 self-contained flats with associated works including the creation of mezzanine floors at second floor level
decision_conditions: The proposed conversion of the ballroom by reason of the subdivision of the first floor and the poorly designed and detailed mezzanine floors would cause substantial harm to the character, appearance and significance of the Grade II Listed Building and would be contrary to the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, National Planning Policy Framework Section 16, London Plan (2016) Policies 7.6 and 7.8, Draft London Plan (December 2019) Policy HC1 and Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) Policy 7C. | The proposed development fails to demonstrate that the loss of significance and substantial harm to the heritage assets is justified through securing substantial public benefits neither has it been demonstrated that the significance of the heritage asset cannot be secured by alternative less harmful uses or through granting funding or not for profit charitable ownership contrary to the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, National Planning Policy Framework Section 16, London Plan (2016) Policy 7.8, Draft London Plan (December 2019) Policy HC1 and Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) Policy 7C. | The proposal would provide no cycle parking contrary to London Plan (2016) Policy 6.13 and Draft London Plan (December 2019) Policy T5. | Inadequate access arrangements to waste storage facilities, contrary to London Plan (2016) Policy 5.17 Draft London Plan (December 2019) Policy SI7 of the Draft London Plan and Ealing's SPG 4 - Storing waste for recycling and disposal. | In the absence of the necessary planning obligation to secure the development as a car free development and prevent future occupiers from applying for parking permits the development is contrary to London Plan (2016) Policy 6.13 and Draft London Plan (December 2019) Policy T6 and T6.1.
